paper_abstract: This paper presents a parameterized version of the stochastic information gradient (SIG) algorithm, in which the error distribution is modeled by generalized Gaussian density (GGD), with location, shape, and dispersion parameters. Compared with the kernel-based SIG (SIG-Kernel) algorithm, the GGD-based SIG (SIG-GGD) algorithm does not involve kernel width selection. If the error is zero-mean, the SIG-GGD algorithm will become the least mean p-power (LMP) algorithm with adaptive order and variable step-size. Due to its well matched density estimation and automatic switching capability, the proposed algorithm is favorably in line with existing algorithms.
paper_title: STOCHASTIC INFORMATION GRADIENT ALGORITHM WITH GENERALIZED GAUSSIAN DISTRIBUTION MODEL
